se.kth.inda.indaprojekt.engine

Class Spell

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.kth.inda.indaprojekt.engine.Spell
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FireBall, ShockwaveSpell, TeleportSpell

    public abstract class Spell
extends java.lang.Object
    A Spell is an non-material object that is casted by Wizards and affects a Level. A Spell has a mana cost that defines how much mana a Wizard need to spend in order to execute it.
    Author:
    David Masko

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Spell(Level level)
      Creates a new Spell whose effects affects the given Level.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void executeSpell(Wizard source, double x, double y)
      Unleashes the effects of this spell with the given Wizard as the source of origin and the given position as target.
      abstract int getManaCost()
      The mana cost of this Spell.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Spell

        public Spell(Level level)
        Creates a new Spell whose effects affects the given Level.
        Parameters:
        level - The Level this spell will affect once executed.

    • Method Detail

      • getManaCost

        public abstract int getManaCost()
        The mana cost of this Spell.
        Returns:
        The mana cost of this Spell.

      • executeSpell

        public abstract void executeSpell(Wizard source,
                double x,
                double y)
        Unleashes the effects of this spell with the given Wizard as the source of origin and the given position as target.
        Parameters:
        source - The Wizard that has executed the spell.
        x - The x-position of the targeted position.
        y - The y-position of the targeted position.
